AJAX was less harsh on my hair than this stuff.<br /><br />It smells HORRIBLE and chemical-ish (thankfully the fragrance doesn't seem to stay in the hair after it's dry) but the worst part about it is that it's got an ingredient or ingredientS that roughs up or swells the hair cuticle, which means my long, mid-back length, highlighted hair is IMPOSSIBLE to comb through after shampooing, even after using a handful of the companion conditioner from this product line.<br /><br />Having long hair all my life means I know how to properly shampoo it to prevent tangling. Knots and tangles are brushed/combed out pre-shampoo, then I suds up the scalp area only and gently run the suds through the length, and NEVER EVER pile the length on top of my head. Regardless, after I am done using this shampoo, it's like I ran my entire head of hair through a blender, the knots and tangles are so bad. I can't imagine how this could possible prevent hair loss, as even with gentle combing post-shampoo and condition, I end up tearing out a lot of hair because of all the tangles. I will never repurchase this damaging, hair-ruining shampoo again, and only wish I could return the bottle I got. Ugh.

Another customer had mentioned using Pura d'or in combination with the Laser Comb, so I thought I would give it a try. I can't say if it is one product or the other, or the combination of the two, but I'll continue using both. The shampoo also leaves my hair so soft and it smells nice, but not overpowering.   184. What people should really know about the gold version is that it has Ketoconazole 0.9% in it! The blue version does not. It is the one difference that screams out loud when comparing gold to blue. This is the only chemical used in lots of expensive hair loss products and it's been proven in studies to help. I do believe the herbs have also been proven and many of them used to be part of the old &#34;Nioxin complex&#34; before proctor and gamble bought and destroyed that product line (I used it prior to Pura for 13 years) only leaving nettles in the shampoo. I have basically been adding Ketoconazole to my mix with the blue version of Pura D' Or for the last two years.   259. I bought the Organic (Gold Label) version in October (4 months ago). Before it, I used the Blue Label for over a year. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0079R6BD2/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1<br />In general, this is how things happened:<br /><br />At the time I bought the blue label-<br />-I was 29.<br />-My hairline was receding steadily if not at an accelerated pace.<br />-I was using Head & Shoulders, sometime Neutrogena's T-gel, and Bed Head Wax.<br />-I would always only pat my wet hair with a towel after taking a shower (that helps).<br />-I used a blow dryer regularly, but for short amounts of time, and mainly for styling.<br />-Anytime i would run my hand through my hair, I would be left with a lot of strands in my hand.<br /><br />I read that the results of using the shampoo wouldn't be visible immediately, but in my experience-<br />-After the very first use, my hair felt like it wasn't coated with shampoo residue anymore. (Could be that I was imagining it, but that's what it felt like in my hands)<br />-After it dried, i kept running my hand through my hair (gently), and there were close to no strands picked up by the palm of my hand.<br />-The receding of the hairline did slow down, but I believe I started to visibly notice after about 4 weeks of use.<br />-The rest of my hair styling practices remained the same, except that I pretty much stopped using wax, and switched Beach Babe Sea Salt Spray. (It's salty, but I like the matte finish).<br />-I still blow dry.<br />-I don't use Head & shoulders, but when my scalp gets dry i split my shower time between a Neutrogena dandruff shampoo (forgot which one this time) and Pura d'Or.<br />-I usually only use 1 pump of Pura d'or.<br /><br />When the blue label bottle was near empty, my hair started falling again. And it seemed like it was doing so with vengeance. I hadn't changed any of my habits. The only thing i can think of was that the last of the shampoo was somehow water down from the shower?? I don't know.<br /><br />I decided to buy the Gold Label this time around, and toss the last of the blue one.<br />After about 1-2 weeks of use, the hair fall stopped or slowed again.<br />My habits remain the same, except that I am now also using a tiny bit of wax (just for the tips).<br /><br />-My hairline is definitely still receding, but at a much much slower pace than before I used the shampoo.<br />-There are plenty of days when I am close taking a razor to my head and make it silky smooth. But then I shower and style it, and I'm satisfied with it again, so I change my mind.<br />-I cut my own hair, so it gives me the freedom to experiment with hairstyles that work better (or not) with the hair I have.<br />-I think the thing I like the most about this shampoo is damn ease of using it. Simply put, it has a noticeably positive effect on my hair, it doesn't seem to be loaded with chemicals (i think), and I don't have to do anything differently in my day. I just take a regular shower.ower?? I don't know.<br /><br />I decided to buy the Gold Label this time around, and toss the last of the blue one.<br />After about 1-2 weeks of use, the hair fall stopped or slowed again.<br />My habits remain the same, except that I am now also using a tiny bit of wax (just for the tips).<br /><br />-My hairline is definitely still receding, but at a much much slower pace than before I used the shampoo.<br />-There are plenty of days when I am close taking a razor to my head and make it silky smooth. I have tried several methods for stopping my considerable and ongoing thinning and hair loss and found nothing that worked for the long haul until I read about and tried Pura d'or Premium Organic argon oil shampoo. I have been using it for six months, along with daily applications of Women's Rogaine to my scalp, and experienced a rapid reduction in the amount of hair that had been falling out in the shower or when brushing, combing and styling my hair. It is either this product or a combination of the shampoo with the Rogaine that markedly reduced my hair loss. It is not the Rogaine alone that worked for me, because I had been using that product by itself a few years ago, and found that it effected very little reduction in my hair loss. So, needless to say, the results I have had using Pura d'or shampoo and Rogaine together have produced thicker, healthy and shiny hair with what I would call normal daily loss of a few hairs. I am thrilled with the results I see when I look in the mirror!

Take before and after pictures to see how your hair is progressing. Read my full story when you have time. It will tell you how the first year went. Also, I have just purchased and left a review for Pura D'OR Deep Moisturizing Conditioner, which pairs nicely with the shampoo especially of you have dry, curly, or hard to comb out hair. If you have hair that goes flat in one day (fine and oily) then go with the regular &#34;blue label&#34; conditioner. I am very impressed with all of these products. Please email me if you have questions and please like my review if it helped you. I PAID FULL PRICE AND WAS NOT COMPENSATED FOR MY REVIEW. I have no interest or affiliation with the manufacturer or seller.<br /><br />MY STORY: I was skeptical when I purchased this shampoo 3 months ago. So skeptical that I took a before and after picture to see if it was working. I had pretty full hair until I became of a certain age. Slowly I could see my hair thinning, especially in the front. I went to a dermatologist who told me there was not much I could do. I wanted to tell myself that it wasn't true but I would not only find hair all over the shower but everywhere else, too. As far as me, I shampoo daily and have for many years. This shampoo has a pleasant smell (reminds me of incense) but not overpowering or lingering. You will probably need a conditioner afterwards as it appears to be very cleansing. I have colored hair and it did not strip the color. My hair now has body, much more shine and is noticeably thicker. I think you can see that by my before and after pictures. I hope you will give it a try before you give up on your hair.<br /><br />SIX MONTH UPDATE: After six months my hair has stayed thicker with no hair loss. I do continue to use Pura D'or Premium at least three days a weeks. I do switch off with low poo shampoo or apple cider vinegar a few times a week also. Like many women, my hair feels dryer or oiler as the seasons and weather changes. Also, even with great products sometimes switching it up is good! By the way, it pays to stick with this shampoo exclusively for at least three months. It takes time for hair to grow and to see a difference. Hope the update can help someone who is agonizing over thinning hair.<br /><br />Picture: I am adding two pictures (3&4) taken today 7/3/2015. I am 6 months out from first using this shampoo and about 5 months out of using the Pura D'or conditioner, which I left a review for today. Finally. As you may notice I need a touch up and also I am holding my hair back tightly like the before picture. The last one is how I normally wear my hair today. No more shortie bangs to TRY to cover the bald spot<br />(never works!) Any questions please ask.<br /><br />ONE YEAR UPDATE: I placed my first order of Pura d'or Gold Label on 1/7/2015. So, I am pretty close to using it for one year. I took a few pictures today. I don't know if I really have any improvement over the last 6 months, maybe a little. Certainly, I have much improvement over my very first picture. My hair was broken off and very sparse at least an inch or two in. My scalp looked red and a bit angry. My fine front hair is definately a little longer at this point and you can't see my scalp anymore. My hair dresser said my hair was overall a bit thicker in December. This is the first time she has said that and I ask her EVERY time!! I have gotten used to using this shampoo which has no silicones and makes your hair a bit tangled before conditioning. I was so used to the slickness of silicones that I figured that this shampoo was drying out my hair. It was not. I have learned that the silicones can build up and also lead to hairloss. So it is a reason to keep using this shampoo and conditioner or at least one that is silicone free. I do recommend trying the Pura d'or Conditioner. I've seen a few complaints about not lathering but I found with shampoos of this type that the first wash does not lather well, but the second does. You can also use a small drop of a regular commercial brand shampoo to wash it first, then quickly rinse and wash with Pura d'or leaving it on for 2 minutes plus (5 minutes is optimum from what I've read for the ketoconazole to work). Plus, I've tried other shampoos with this ingredient and the bottles are much smaller for the same price or more. I'll try to update the review as more time is logged with it.

  665. This is my 2nd review of Pura D'or Premium (Gold Label) Shampoo. My first review was posted after two months of use, and at that time I was already experiencing positive results.<br /><br />I was losing hair rapidly in the year leading up to purchasing this product, and it seemed to be accelerating. My hair was feeling limp, and sometimes crunchy. I took a picture of the top of my head one day, and was shocked to see almost a full 3-4&#34; circle of scalp exposed on the top of my head. Obviously, I started looking for solutions, and found this. I'd say my hair loss dropped off substantially within months of use. People may try to attribute this to natural shed cycles, but now with over a year of use (and just finishing my 2nd bottle!) I can say that I've never seen any shedding return. I'm no longer seeing dozens of hairs on my hands while shampooing or on my pillow, just a few here and there.<br /><br />My scalp isn't as itchy and has no build up. The hair itself feels healthier and somewhat thicker (I have fine hair to begin with). I believe this product halted my hair loss, which was perhaps the most dramatic effect, and has had a minor effect in returning some coverage on top. There is much less scalp showing, but you can still tell that it's thin up there. I'm good with it tho. I really believe had I started earlier with this, that I'd still have almost full coverage.<br /><br />A bottle really last forever too. As stated above, I'm finishing my 2nd bottle now. I'd say I use it 5-6 times a week, and make sure to leave on for about 5 mins while showering, making it more convenient that other hair loss products, with no side effects, and a low cost (&#60;$80 for the year, and my normal Aveda shampoo was just as expensive anyways).
  666. I used one full bottle of Pura D'or gold shampoo and it did not lessen hair fallout or bring about hair regrowth. Instructions say to use it daily and leave on at least three minutes. I used it every other day and left it on for three minutes. Some users report only needing 1 pump's worth to cover scalp area; I usually needed 2-3 unless I pre-washed with another shampoo (I am a woman with shoulder length hair). Still, the bottle lasted a long time (I would guess with daily use of 1-2 pumps quantity that it would last 30 days at least). The shampoo has a very odd smell that I did not find pleasant but that does not linger after use. It did clean my scalp/hair satisfactorily. This product may work if you use it every day, but since it is only on your scalp briefly, I don't see how it can. When I started, I did not wash my hair every day because I read that's not good but my hair gets oily so it looks really thin after a day of not washing it. I notice hair falling out after my first few washes, but then it stopped and it looks like it's getting thicker.<br /><br />Like I said, I'm going to use this daily and come back in 3 months with an update. I also take 10,000mcg Biotin tablets as well so hopefully, I get some good results. Wish me luck!!<br /><br />UPDATE:<br /><br />Sorry for the late update! I'm still using the product. From when I bought it till now, I'm still on my first bottle and it's only about half empty. I still wash my hair every day so it'll definitely last a while. Once I got the product and submitted this original review, I went to the link Pura d'or provided in the packaging and filled out the form. In less than 2 weeks, they shipped me my second bottle so I'm really happy about that! The fact that I'm still on my first bottle definitely makes me feel like I got my money's worth.<br /><br />As for the results, I'm still a little bit torn. As I mentioned in my initial review, my hair gets oily if I don't wash it every day and when it does get oily, it looks extra thin. Using this shampoo didn't change that unfortunately. I did let my hair grow out a little more (just an extra 1/2 inch or so) so after a wash with the shampoo, it does look fuller. I just have to make sure I wash it every night. I've also notice that when I wash it every night, less and less hair starts to falling out and after a while, there's barely any hair (remember though, your hairs have cycles so some will eventually fall out). Now I don't know if that's due to the Biotin I'm taking for the shampoo but I continue to do both and I really recommend the same to other people in my position. Some tips: They recommend to leave it on your scalp for 2-3 minutes before rinsing so make sure you follow that!<br /><br />I will update again in a couple of months and hopefully get better results! If you have any tips or advice that worked for you, please leave it in the comments for me and others to see.about half empty. I still wash my hair every day so it'll definitely last a while.   772. I have fine hair that is about 1/3 of the normal thickness, is fragile, and color treated.<br /><br />With Pura d'or use over the past couple of months, I think I have finally found something without a bunch of chemicals that actually works. My hair is now becoming the hair that I used to have. There is new hair growth, shine, and more volume. It feels stronger and soft, but not fly-away fine hair. My hair routine is becoming simpler. I find I do not need to use heat with the hair dryer and don't have to completely dry it. I can also let it air dry at home before brushing it out and it turns out nice. I am also getting to the point where I do not need hairspray.<br /><br />For me, the best way to use this shampoo is to use once a day, using enough to be able to create a good lather, massaging into the scalp, and then leaving in for 2 minutes (and no more, or the shampoo will start to dry the hair). The hair will feel &#34;dry&#34; after a towel dry and that is normal. Use spray in conditioner for the ends mainly, and use a Wet Brush to distribute the spray in conditioner. I use Redken Blonde Idol conditioner, which does not weigh down the hair. The Wet Brush will not break your hair like combs do. I use a little Redken Guts mousse to style. My hair looks the best it has looked in a few years. I will keep you posted as to continued results.

  817. I contacted Pura D'or regarding this product a month ago. My question to them was - Does this product contain Ketoconazole.<br /><br />The two people that responded to my emails did not know. They seemed pretty certain that the ingredients were currently being updated and Ketoconazole was being removed. Based on this I purchased several bottles.<br /><br />I received my order only to find after using this product, it contained Ketoconazole and several other surfactants not listed on the Pura D'or website not on any listing on Amazon.<br /><br />I asked Pura D'or once again about Ketaconazole and they once again assured me it was being removed. However, a month later the ingredients for this product have been updated on Pura D'ors website to list Ketaconazole and even the quantity of this ingredient in their product. Also, listings on Amazon have been revised to list Ketaconazole as an ingredient.<br /><br />I am only writing this review to make other buyers aware that you need to be careful about what you are actually purchasing here. Some of the bottles of Pura D'or Premium I received were battered and quite dusty and the labels appeared sun faded as if they were quite old.<br /><br />I am still pretty certain one bottle I tried to use contained essential oils that had gone rancid as I had a severe reaction.<br /><br />All in all this is a good product, however it is a little hit and miss as to whether or not you receive a good, fresh bottle.

I would lose probably 100 hairs every time I would brush my hair and another 150-200 every time I'd wash my hair. It terrified me at how much hair I was losing because I was getting very noticeable thin spots around my hairline. I went to the dermatologist and she recommended I try biotin and Rogaine. I tried Rogaine for 1 1/2 weeks and couldn't stand the itching and flakes that it caused. I've tried hair loss serums, vitamins, etc, and nothing has remotely came close to slowing my shedding. I ordered this shampoo with not too high of hopes, honestly. To my amazement, my hair loss dramatically decreased within a couple weeks of using this shampoo!! I'm not even kidding!! I'm completely shocked at how well this stuff works! I maybe lose 2-3 hairs when I brush now and only 10-15 when I wash!! This has been a miracle for me and I'm so happy! It's an all around great shampoo too. It smells wonderful, it lathers up really nicely, and it's organic and made from healthy ingredients. I haven't noticed it drying out my hair at all, but I do follow it up with a conditioner. I might add.....I started taking NOW brand double strength black current seed oil capsules at about the same time as I started using this shampoo. Research black current oil and hair loss, there's tons of info on how it helps. I think the capsules and the shampoo are working really well together for me!<br />Thank goodness I'm not going bald anymore!!

  922. I know there's a lot of fake reviews out there for this product so rest assured, this one is coming from a regular guy. I started using the product in-part because of the reviews, so I want to do my best to share my experience and help others. I started using the product in July 2015 so I feel I am in a position to give a fair assessment. And, yes, I've been using the shampoo correctly by letting it sit at least 2 minutes. And I have been using it at least a few times every week for the past year. I am a caucasian male in my late 20's. My hair type is straight and fine. I have noticed slight thinning all over the top of my head since my early 20's, not a severe case. No bald spots and not really any issues with hairline. The concern was/is if it gets worse. That's why I started looking at products that are available and that's how I came across this one.<br /><br />What everyone wants to know: has the product thickened my hair? Short answer, no. If you have bald spots or a receding hairline, I would not expect the product to work miracles. If that was the case, then this product would be a heck of a lot more popular, that's for sure. And the ingredients would be widespread and not just in a shampoo.<br /><br />So why 4 stars? That's where the longer answer comes in. I do feel that my hair is much healthier and, in turn, looks a slightly thicker and fuller. Do the DHT-blocking ingredients work as a preventative measure to at least slow and deter the balding process? I'd like to think so, but it's impossible to say. My hunch says probably not; don't expect miracles. But I guess any little bit you can try to help your hair doesn't hurt.<br /><br />While 30 to 35 bucks for a shampoo is obviously more pricey than what I was used to, I'm still only on my second bottle in one year of use so it doesn't bother me. I use 2-3 pumps for each shampoo, depending on length of my hair. It gives an ok lather - not as good as a &#34;regular&#34; shampoo and the lather seems to dissipate when you let it sit in your hair (as advised on the bottle) and it gets all soaked in, but I don't really care about that. It has a unique smell out of the bottle - personally I like it, but it doesn't matter since you can't smell it on your hair after rinsing.<br /><br />I would NOT advise using everyday as it will dry your hair out. At least, that's what it did to my hair type. Dry hair is awful; nobody wants that dry, stiff, dull, straw-like texture - it doesn't style well at all and can make hair look thinner. But I think that's the case with any shampoo - you don't want to use it everyday. On the days I do NOT shampoo in the shower, I will rinse and scrub my hair vigorously with my hands (as if it did have shampoo) with ONLY with hot water. Then I finish with a blast of cold water to close the hair cuticles. This has works like a charm - it gets rid of all the surface oils that make hair limp and look dirty, yet hair remains properly hydrated and styles well, has body, shine, etc.<br /><br />On the days I do shampoo? Which is typically every 3 days or so. I don't even need conditioner. Hair is soft, clean, and has a great shine. I like that it has all-natural ingredients and no harsh chemicals as well. I did not give 5-stars because the company does seem a little shady by making bold claims to capitalize on the millions of vulnerable people suffering from hair loss and the fake reviews here are real shady.ate when you let it sit in your hair (as advised on the bottle) and it gets all soaked in, but I don't really care about that. It has a unique smell out of the bottle - personally I like it, but it doesn't matter since you can't smell it on your hair after rinsing.<br /><br />I would NOT advise using everyday as it will dry your hair out. At least, that's what it did to my hair type. Dry hair is awful; nobody wants that dry, stiff, dull, straw-like texture - it doesn't style well at all and can make hair look thinner. But I think that's the case with any shampoo - you don't want to use it everyday. On the days I do NOT shampoo in the shower, I will rinse and scrub my hair vigorously with my hands (as if it did have shampoo) with ONLY with hot water. Then I finish with a blast of cold water to close the hair cuticles. This has works like a charm - it gets rid of all the surface oils that make hair limp and look dirty, yet hair remains properly hydrated and styles well, has body, shine, etc.<br /><br />On the days I do shampoo? Which is typically every 3 days or so. I don't even need conditioner. Hair is soft, clean, and has a great shine. I like that it has all-natural ingredients and no harsh chemicals as well.   1143. First off I will say that I have tried a few other shampoos to prevent hair loss or to try to regrow some areas. While none of them are quick solutions, I have had some success with these types of products, where I have less loose hair that falls out, and I even notice some new hairs in my widows peak. So these products do help, compared to regular shampoos, such as Head&Shoulders or Suave, or whatever. I believe my use of Head&Shoulders or just liquid soap while in the military with very little hair instigated much of my hair loss. I have the receding hair lines and a very thin patch on the back top. So there is no reason to believe these type of shampoos are just snake oil, they do help hair growth/health. Which one you pick is the question. After trying about three others I was getting frustrated with the application instructions or the way the shampoo left my hair feeling.<br /><br />Some are already paired with a conditioner, or others say you can use any conditioner, but I have never used conditioner before, seems like a waste of time, unless apparently you have long hair or use a shampoo that leaves your hair with a dry sticky feeling.<br /><br />The worst part about most of these shampoos is it tells you to put it your hair for a few minutes, then rinse and repeat for a few more minutes. Then you can use a conditioner after that. I am not motivated enough to put it in my hair outside the shower or turn the water on and off while standing around, and waiting with the water on is a waste (in a 5 year drought here in CA). Aside from the all natural ingredients and helping me prevent hair loss, this is the best part about the pura d'or for me. It says to apply once, lather and leave in for about 2 minutes then rinse and you're done. So you're not wasting more of the shampoo, water, or time with reapplications.<br /><br />The next best thing I like about this product is that it is concentrated, it only requires about half a pump for my hair which is about 2 inches long on top and tapered down. It will last a long time and the bottle is small, and no hassle with a cap in the shower. The first time I put a whole pump in my hair and I had suds running down all over.<br /><br />I have found a couple not as favorable things about this shampoo. To get a good quick lather it seems I need clean hair to start with. If I do not wash my hair first the pura d'or will not lather even if I add more of it with my hair wet. If I wash my hair first with any shampoo then the pura d'or lathers easily its wonderful. When I say I pre-wash, its just a quick shampoo application and then immediately rinse it out, no waiting. This could just be the way it works in my hair, because the hair is kind of thin and I sweat quite a bit, it can get a little greasy I suppose between washings.<br /><br />The second thing I noticed is that it leaves my hair feeling differently than I have ever felt before, almost squeaky clean, not dry, just odd to me. Its honestly fine, and the feeling is gone once its actually dry, and I had no issues with my scalp drying out either. To kill two birds with one stone, for my quick pre-wash that I do for reasons described above, I use a shampoo that has Moroccan oil in it. This counteracts the squeaky clean feeling in my hair from the pura d'or. Then I don't use a conditioner. If I didn't pre-wash my hair to get the better lathering effect, then I wouldn't bother with anything to condition the hair, because it feels fine with just this shampoo, just different.<br /><br />I would recommend this shampoo, especially for those of us that are impatient.bout 2 inches long on top and tapered down. It will last a long time and the bottle is small, and no hassle with a cap in the shower. The first time I put a whole pump in my hair and I had suds running down all over.<br /><br />I have found a couple not as favorable things about this shampoo. To get a good quick lather it seems I need clean hair to start with. If I do not wash my hair first the pura d'or will not lather even if I add more of it with my hair wet. If I wash my hair first with any shampoo then the pura d'or lathers easily its wonderful. When I say I pre-wash, its just a quick shampoo application and then immediately rinse it out, no waiting. This could just be the way it works in my hair, because the hair is kind of thin and I sweat quite a bit, it can get a little greasy I suppose between washings.<br /><br />The second thing I noticed is that it leaves my hair feeling differently than I have ever felt before, almost squeaky clean, not dry, just odd to me. Its honestly fine, and the feeling is gone once its actually dry, and I had no issues with my scalp drying out either. To kill two birds with one stone, for my quick pre-wash that I do for reasons described above, I use a shampoo that has Moroccan oil in it. This counteracts the squeaky clean feeling in my hair from the pura d'or. Then I don't use a conditioner. If I didn't pre-wash my hair to get the better lathering effect, then I wouldn't bother with anything to condition the hair, because it feels fine with just this shampoo, just different.<br /><br />I would recommend this shampoo, especially for those of us that are impatient.

If you don't know the cause of your hair loss have your MD check your A1C (glucose level).<br /><br />Editing my review April 2016 for fellow sufferers: I have found after doing TONS of research trying to find the answers to hair loss that it is important to have a sufficient Ferritin levels (ask your doctor to check your blood), I started taking Iron purchased here on Amazon-Solargar Gentle Iron, 25 mg). You need iron to grow hair. Also, many people do not know that DHT in your system will kill your hair follicles. I have had itchy scalp during shedding periods that had no other symptoms that are common with hair loss such as flaking, inflammation, etc. and I read in a hair loss forum that the ingredients in over the counter Tagamet can block the DHT from attacking your hair follicle. I purchased it here on Amazon for less than Target. Yes, two a day, along with Iron, this shampoo and Nizerol 2% and my hair is growing back, rapidly I am so happy to say. If you have an issue with breakthrough itch which I'd have occasionally and would cause a shed I used Children's Benadryl. It will also stop the itch within hours and it too blocks the DHT but is not good for long-term use. Jason Thin to Thick is also a great shampoo and conditioner if your hair is thinning (available here on Amazon) and it smells great. I know many doctors are not much help and do not make your hair loss a priority so it was through my own research that I discovered these things.

  1451. I am a 54 year old female experiencing hair loss related to peri-menopause. It was very discouraging to see a lot of hair in my brush, on my clothing, and even in my vacuum cleaner! I have been using it daily for about a month and I am so pleased with the results than I have just ordered my second bottle. It has noticeably reduced the shedding. I no longer have hairs randomly falling off throughout the day and when I comb out my hair after shampooing far fewer strands are shed. Not only does this product help with my hair loss, it also makes my hair feel so clean and has stopped my scalp itch. I appreciate the organic ingredients and I plan to continue using this product. I had been changing shampoos frequently because my hair so often felt weighed down by the parabens and waxes they contain. Ladies, although hair loss is fairly common due to hormonal changes during menopause, be sure to rule out other causes for shedding; thyroid disease and certain medications can cause hair loss. Also, take a good quality multi-vitamin formulated for women over fifty. Let your hair air dry as often as possible and don't brush excessively. This shampoo is great!

From my experience with hair loss shampoos so far, this drying effect is extremely common, but contrary to the other products, this one makes my hair very shinny and it doesn't mess with my hair color. Another thing to keep in mind is that this shampoo does not foam a lot (which is usual in natural shampoos) so don't use a lot in order to make more to try to produce more foam or you'll end up with crunchy hair. You will NOT go wrong using this product. I also purchased the accompanying conditioner and will leave a separate review for that.<br /><br />P.S. Finally, I found a product that not only works, it's is NOT going to kill me using it! It is so natural and made from mostly vegetables, that you almost can drink it!   1753. I honestly believe this product does not work to reduce hair loss. I'm 26 years old male Asian who has been having hairloss problem since I was 22. I was a student then and have prepared myself for the worst. Before this shampoo I have tried nioxin system 2 which at that time was somewhere among the highest rated hairloss shampoo in amazon. Of course, now it's drowned somewhere under for no reason. These hairloss shampoos are definitely better than over the counters in term of result and ingredients. But that's about it, it gives you a fuller hair, peace of mind that it contains DHT &quot;blocking&quot; ingredients and the high reviews. You use them and that's what's in your head in the shower.<br /><br />I actually liked the Nioxin system 2 better because it gives you a tingling mint sensation after you use them and it smells wayyyy better than these. This shampoo for some reason have a terrible smell, it's definitely chemical-ly smell and whenever I use them it just feels like I'm doing it for the sake of not wasting the $30 I spent on them. The reviews on these are so convincing, the before and after pictures, the overwhelmingly positive reviews. If you dig further into the reviews you'll find that most of them 80% are fakes or biased. The shampoo came with a tag that if you write &quot;honest&quot; review you'll get a free bottle. Some people have written that they wrote 1-4 stars and never got them. So if you're buying these based on reviews, I'd suggest you think very carefully.<br /><br />But now, let's get on the positive side. The shampoo contains Argan oil and biotin. Arguably, some of the best ingredients you could find in a higher end shampoo. Which is great!, because while they're definitely not going to regrow your hair, you could definitely use healthy ingredients for your hair.<br /><br />Anyway, I'm not halfway through the bottle and I'm just waiting for it to run out and get my money's worth. I just can't stand the smell tbh, if they were nicer in smell I'll probably be using them for a lot longer just for the fact that they do contain healthy ingredients.<br /><br />Hope this helps boys, hairloss is genetics, don't mess with it.n smell I'll probably be using them for a lot longer just for the fact that they do contain healthy ingredients.<br /><br />Hope this helps boys, hairloss is genetics, don't mess with it.

After 2 weeks, I noticed that I usually had ALMOST NO STRANDS of hair in my hand every time I washed my hair, and I'm seeing maybe 1-3 strands in my detangling comb. As an added bonus, my hair looks shiny, bouncy and healthy without any flyaways, and it styles so easily now. For styling, I used to use mousse, texturizer, hair spray, blow dryer, hot air blow-dry brush, velcro rollers and (sometimes) a flat iron to get a style that lasts for maybe 3 hours before it starts looking limp and oily! Now I use just a hot air blow dry brush and a little bit of hair spray, and the style, bounce and shine lasts all day.<br /><br />The only thing that I don't like about it is the smell, but that doesn't stay in my hair, and compared to the benefits that I'm getting, I can live with it.<br /><br />I will definitely be ordering this product again as soon as I start running low.<br /><br />For the record - I'm not being reimbursed by the company for this review - I'm a real customer who purchased this product.

At 69, grey hair can look dry and yellowy; not mine.<br /><br />I WILL BE REORDERING THIS PRODUCT; because my hair looks and feels soft, luscious, and shiny.<br /><br />I have received no compensation in the form of products or money for this review.

  1958. I don't typically do product reviews but felt compelled to leave feedback for Pura d'or Premium Organic Anti-Hair Loss Shampoo. Let me start by saying I didn't purchase this product for the obvious reason...hair loss. Although I have a little thinning on the front and the temples, I had a different intention in mind. You see, I am extremely sensitive to dyes, chemicals and perfumes typically found in non-organic shampoos so I'm always keeping a weary eye out for organic products that have great reviews. Store bought shampoos cause oily, crusty spots on the scalp that is made worse by letting wet hair dry naturally. Mix in the chemical swill in commercial hair products and my scalp was a mess. What I noticed with this product from the very start was the perfume was pretty neutral, almost non-existent. The shampoo is a light amber to clear color that correlates to an absence of dyes. So far so good. It passes the sniff and eye test like a lot of natural products do. Next, I actually used the product in the shower and immediately was impressed with the suds and the cleanliness without feeling like &#34;stripped&#34; chemical hair. It isn't a cheap product but, once again, that wasn't my intent. I can see where people with long hair may want to shampoo first with a cheaper product and then finish with this shampoo. The results were impressive. I have thick hair to begin with and this product actually added body after the first use. Combine that with no chemical reaction, i.e., no oily, crusty spots on my scalp, and I am very pleased. Whether it helps with hair loss or promotes hair growth, time will tell but I am happy that it does what I hoped it would do and this is provide a clean scalp and healthy hair without the negative side effects mentioned previously.

I'm in my mid-twenties and noticed that my hair started thinning at about 20 so I have been really concerned about stopping it. This shampoo suds well, has a non-offensive smell, and does not make my hair too dry or too oily. I do, however, need a very light conditioner afterwards but that's not a big deal. My hair is usually oily by the end of the day but with this shampoo, my hair isn't oily until the next day. I also love that it has natural and organic ingredients and I've been switching most of my products over to ones that are better for my skin and hair. Overall, this shampoo fits the bill for what I've been searching for for the past few years.
  1997. I want to start by saying I was a bit skeptical, I recently started hair shedding and after so much research I came across this product. After reading a few reviews I went ahead and gave it a try. I am so happy I made this choice, this product doesn't grow hair back that I have noticed as of yet, but it does stop the shedding which to me is better then nothing. I spent the next few moments digging around his hair, trying to see if I had looked at the wrong spot. No bald spots ANYWHERE. He had only been using this product for about a month. I am waiting for my 1 month result to be as great as his, with one spot on my head that has always been scant to fill in. Even with daily use, it lasts a decent amount of time because of the way it is dispensed in measured pumps.   2043. I am 31 year old male and have been battling a receding hairline since my mid 20's. I was first turned on to ProDesign ReviveTH Thinning Hair Shampoo/Conditioner/Treatment system by a hair stylist friend of mine back in my mid 20's which was working pretty well for me as far as thickening up the hair I already had, but didn't seem to do much for regrowth. After noticing my hair line receding more and more last year, I decided to finally break down and try Rogaine along with it. It seemed to be helping but more towards the back of my head but my front hairline was getting worse and the expense and time with Rogaine didn't seem worth it. It also seemed to be causing breakouts on my forehead.<br /><br />I did some more research and discovered that DHT is one of the main causes of hair loss. After researching more into ProDesign ReviveTH and Rogaine (Minoxidil), I discovered that neither of these actually blocks DHT. So after searching out for a better shampoo that claims to block DHT I came across this Pura d'or Premium Organic Anti-Hair Loss Shampoo (Gold Label) that was Amazon's best seller and had great reviews. The thickening and DHT blocking was exactly what I was looking for and the price was great for how much you get. I figured I had only hair to gain, so I gave it a try.<br /><br />After about a month of use, I noticed less hair in the shower and on my sink then I had seen in quite awhile. And mind you it is less than when I was on Rogaine and ProDesign ReviveTH. My hair also has thickened up quite a bit and is much easier to style. This also moisturizes my hair and scalp so well that I discontinued the use of my conditioner due to the conditioner seemed to be overkill on the moisturization, making my hair harder to style (another great money saver there!). Due to my research on DHT, I also found a Hairomega Pill that contains a DHT blocker as well. I combined these with this shampoo to give me extra DHT blocking. I definitely can say my hair loss has all but stopped and will have to give it a few months before I can claim any regrowth, but so far this is the best solution I have found!<br /><br />Highly recommend!stopped and will have to give it a few months before I can claim any regrowth, but so far this is the best solution I have found!<br /><br />Highly recommend!

  2047. I recently had my second hair transplant procedure in 12 years, and while I'm very happy with the results (Dr. Bolton's one of the BEST in N. America), I was looking for some products to help protect my investment. Almost every shampoo designed for thinning hair and/or to help with re-growth seems to be loaded with crazy chemicals I don't recognize, much less can even pronounce the names of. Pura d'or's (Gold Label) shampoo is formulated with plant derived substances that are clearly marked on the label.<br /><br />And being into Traditional Chinese Medicine, I'm particularly interested in herbal derivatives or extracts that can block DHT at the follicle with out wreaking havoc on my hormones like, unfortunately, finasteride (Propecia/Proscar)does. Pura d'or's choice of herbal extracts and ingredients are top notch, it smells good, lathers nicely, and leaves my hair feeling very soft and clean. While I've only been using it for a couple of weeks now, I have confidence that the shampoo will help do it's intended job of keeping DHT at bay on my scalp, while helping to nourish the follicles at the same time. And all with out harsh chemicals or preservatives that are questionable at best.<br /><br />I'll update every 3-4 months for a year to let everyone know how effective it's been for me...<br /><br />Update:10/2/14<br />It's been over 3 months since I started using this shampoo. Now granted, as you've read I had gotten a hair transplant a couple of weeks prior. The newly transplanted hair is coming in great by the way, and although it's honestly too soon to tell whether the Pura d'or Gold label formula is helping to accelerate and/or nourish the new grafts, I feel that the ingredients are very helpful and supportive, as you'll notice many of them are used in prostate formulas, since there's a connection between benign prostrate hypertrophy(gradual enlarging of the prostrate) and male pattern baldness. The secret ingredient in my opinion being He Shou Wu/Fo Ti, a very good DHT regulator of the body. Note, see one of my responses to a reader's question on my thoughts on HSW/Fo Ti, for more info. I love the earthy herbal smell of the shampoo, and it lathers really nicely as well. I've since had my hair cut shorter than I've worn in years, thanks to the new grafts coming along nicely, so even though a bottle of the Gold Label stuff is kind of pricey, it should last me at least 6-7 months. When you break the cost down by the month it's pretty reasonable. I'll update again in about another 90 days.<br /><br />Update:1/11/15<br />It's now been over 6 months since I started using the shampoo, and still very happy w/it. The transplanted grafts are almost at full maturity and I'm very pleased w/the results and feel the shampoo is indeed helping to nourish them as well as my scalp in general. Since it's winter now and I'm not washing my hair everyday, as I feel it makes the scalp too dry, but the bottle will easily last me beyond 6 months because of this. So again, the price is justified.good DHT regulator of the body. Note, see one of my responses to a reader's question on my thoughts on HSW/Fo Ti, for more info. I love the earthy herbal smell of the shampoo, and it lathers really nicely as well. I've since had my hair cut shorter than I've worn in years, thanks to the new grafts coming along nicely, so even though a bottle of the Gold Label stuff is kind of pricey, it should last me at least 6-7 months. When you break the cost down by the month it's pretty reasonable. I'll update again in about another 90 days.<br /><br />Update:1/11/15<br />It's now been over 6 months since I started using the shampoo, and still very happy w/it. The transplanted grafts are almost at full maturity and I'm very pleased w/the results and feel the shampoo is indeed helping to nourish them as well as my scalp in general. Since it's winter now and I'm not washing my hair everyday, as I feel it makes the scalp too dry, but the bottle will easily last me beyond 6 months because of this. So again, the price is justified.

But my hair appointment today with my stylist confirmed that I really am seeing results. She kept commenting on all the new growth and said there is quite a bit about. She asked if I changed my routine or if I was using any new products. I told her I switched to a new shampoo a while back but that's about it. Its such a relief to find out that this actually appears to be working and its being noticed by other people. I am also using this conditioner, as well.<br />One thing I will mention is my hair did seem a bit more oily when I first started using this product, but my scalp/hair seemed to adjust within a week to where that wasn't a problem. It was also hard to get use to it not producing the amount of lather that other shampoos do. I realize that its most likely due to the ingredients in this product versus the chemicals in others, but it did take a little getting use to.

  2288. I started losing my hair about 2 years ago. Every time I washed my hair (daily) I would see more than I wanted to in the tub. I have tried different salon products and nothing seemed to work. Then, I found this, tried it and I am so very glad I did!!! I have been buying it from Amazon ever since. I will NEVER use anything else. My hair loss stopped almost immediately. I am not kidding! I am being very honest here. I have read some of the 1 and 2 star reviews and I just don't get it.   2296. Was really excited about getting this product after seeing so many positive reviews. I have fine, thin hair and have started having hair loss, which is hereditary. When I opened the shampoo, it smells kind of like medicine. I used it one time. As I was washing my hair, I ran my fingers though it and could feel some hair stands come out. I hurried up and rinsed and applied the condition. As soon as I lifted my head up, I looked in the sink and saw a small clump of hair. I tried to comb it out and more stands where coming out. I hurried up and washed my hair with my regular shampoo like 3 times and hair stopped coming out. It seems to be okay now, but will not use again.
